In India there is an enormous gap between healthcare supply and demand. What do you think are the major steps that can be taken by the government to improve patient care in the country? 

    In india there is an enormous gap between healthcare supply and demand as most of the healthcare organisations do not providing the quality services to the patients so it leads to poor service to the patients.

   Government organisations/hospitals are providing very poor quality service to the patients who are in need. Most of the poor families prefer to go government hospitals as they charge very low fee, but these government hospitals do not take much care about their patients. private organisations are doing much better when compared to government organisations. Compared to government hospitals the private hospitals charge is high. These private organisations always want to show their best to the patients and want to give the quality service to them.

   To overcome this problem the government should take the following steps:

The government should provide free medical camp services once in a month in every village/town.

They should provide equal and fair charges to all the people.

The government should see that all the medical organisations should have all the lab facilities, x-ray rooms and scanning centres with latest equipments.

They should implement new schemes in the healthcare systems like providing free medical facilities to the poor families with low charge, the treatment should made first rather than paying the money first.

Most of the members in the healthcare organisations are corrupted, to make more money by providing treatment to the patients in an unfair manner. The government should punish those people who are involved in this.

The government should make new plans and build hospitals in backward areas.

The government should implement new schemes for poor people by charging less fee and providing concession to them.

         In india their is a demand for healthcare but the supply is not equal to the demand. In some hospitals the doctors/management may demand for more money from the patients as they want make profits.

       Most of the healthcare organisations do not have all the facilities to treat their patients so it leads to lack of supply.

      In earliier days we don't have much technology to improve the healthcare system, but now the days has changed and technology also changed much more, so the government should take a step forward and improve our healthcare system as it leads to better service to our society.

      So i conclude this by saying that, it is important to improve healthcare system in india. for improving the healthcare system the government should implement new schemes and policies for providing better supply of healthcare system in india with all facilities as it leads to not only improving the healthcare system but also helps us to improve our society.
